column4: I installed Kubuntu 10.04, and I really ended up not liking KDE.  If I installed Gnome and then uninstalled KDE, would that be okay?  Or do I actually need to uninstall Kubuntu and install Ubuntu?
before you do what that site says, makesure you sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
then simply: sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop and then run the command that that site says
Okay, that's what I'm doing right now.  I just wanted to make sure if wasn't going to mess anything up.
no, you'll have to install a clean version...you can *access* your windows files by mounting the partition, but that's about it
